brainbox.singlecell: Tools for examining single cell activity¶

The singlecell module is a toolkit for examining the activity of single units within a recording. At the moment we are limited to simple analyses such as autocorrelations, but we aim to expand this feature set in the future.

Functions¶

acorr(spike_times[, bin_size, window_size])

Compute the auto-correlogram of a neuron.

calculate_peths(spike_times, spike_clusters, …)

Calcluate peri-event time histograms; return means and standard deviations for each time point across specified clusters

convolve(in1, in2[, mode, method])

Convolve two N-dimensional arrays.

firing_rate(ts[, hist_win, fr_win])

Computes the instantaneous firing rate of a unit over time by computing a histogram of spike counts over a specified window of time, and summing this histogram over a sliding window of specified time over a specified period of total time.

gaussian(*args, **kwargs)

Return a Gaussian window.

xcorr(spike_times, spike_clusters[, …])

Compute all pairwise cross-correlograms among the clusters appearing in spike_clusters.
